metadata.title: CVE-2016-10266 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
LibTIFF 4.0.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(divide-by-zero error and application crash) via a crafted TIFF image,related to libtiff/tif_read.c:351:22.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10266` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8').
